articles.title: Delegation of Elders Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Elders Here
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- An Elders' delegation headed by Jimmy Carter, ex-president of the United States, arrived here today by chartered plane.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Elders' Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Elders' Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with the elders' delegation headed by Jimmy Carter, ex-president of the U.S., at the Paekhwawon State Guest House on Tuesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.
					 The foreign minister gave a reception for the delegation on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Africa
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Africa
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma, president of South Africa, on the occasion of its national day, Freedom Day.
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger, Kim in the message sincerely wished the President and the South African people successes in their efforts to achieve national unity and socio-economic progress.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Sierra Leone
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Sierra Leone 
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Ernest Bai Koroma, president of Sierra Leone, on Monday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of its independence. 
					 Kim Yong Nam in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in the mutual interests. He wished the President and people of Sierra Leone successes in their efforts to consolidate peace and stability of the country and achieve its socio-economic progress.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Togo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Togo 
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Faure Essozimna Gnassingbe, president of Togo, on April 22 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of its independence. 
					Kim Yong Nam in the message expressed belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger. He wished the President of Togo success in his work for national reconciliation and unity and socio-economic development.

articles.title: DPRK Health Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Health Delegation Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- A DPRK health delegation led by Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, left here Tuesday to attend the First Global Ministerial Conference to be held in Russia.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- A Russian fishery delegation led by Andrei Kraini, head of the Federal Agency of Fisheries, visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on Tuesday to pay homage to him.
					 The delegation laid before the statue a floral basket carrying the unbounded reverence for the President who made immortal contributions to development of the DPRK-Russia friendship and global independence.
					
					 It arrived here that day.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Visits Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Liberation Tower
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- A Russian fishery delegation led by Andrei Kraini, head of the Federal Agency of Fisheries, visited the Liberation Tower on Tuesday.
					 The visitors laid a wreath in the name of the delegation before the tower and paid a silent tribute to the memory of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army.

articles.title: Gifts from Russian, Ecuadorian Personages
articles.content:
Gifts from Russian, Ecuadorian Personages
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from personages of Russia and Ecuador on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They were Alexandr Nikonov, curator of the Central Armed Forces Museum of Russia, and Julio Ballesteros Espin, chairman of the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People.
					
					 The gifts were handed over to officials concerned of the DPRK working in the above-said countries on April 13 and 21.

articles.title: National Festival of Science and Technology Opens
articles.content:
National Festival of Science and Technology Opens
						
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The 26th National Festival of Science and Technology was opened in the DPRK with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Tuesday.
					 It will be held divided into 19 panels including light industry, agriculture, coal, electricity, metal, machinery, biology and chemistry.
					
					 Presented to the festival were at least 350 pieces of scientific and technological achievements which proved successful at local festivals of science and technology and achievements made in more than 20 industrial establishments.
					
					 Attending the ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Ha Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and working people.
					
					 Ri Ja Bang, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission who doubles as chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea, made an opening address.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony its participants went round the festival venue.

articles.title: Architecture Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
Architecture Festival to Be Held
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The 11th May 21 Architecture Festival will take place here from May 3.
					 The festival is to be held in such forms and ways as city-planning and architectural design prize contest, national symposium on architecture and construction and competition for modernization of architectural designing.
					
					 Presented to it will be works selected at provincial festivals, valuable papers, architectural design programs and multimedia.
					
					 There will be the 6th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics during the festival.
					
					 The festival and symposium will bring together architects and construction technicians from across the country.

articles.title: Picture Album "Paleontological Fossils of Korea"
articles.content:
Picture Album "Paleontological Fossils of Korea"
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- A picture album "Paleontological Fossils of Korea" is on display at the Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition.
					 Paleontologists of Kim Il Sung University made the album based on fossils they collected and classified over the past three decades. Their collection is viewed as valuable and scientifically significant. 
					
					 The album contains explanations of circumstances of different geological ages and extinct organisms, reconstruction of natural environment and a major fossil distribution map of the country.
					
					 Also seen in the album are pictures of 103 fossil animals and 51 fossil plants.
					
					 The book is popular among local people as it is conducive to the study of the history of organic evolution and the earth crust movements.
					
					 It also enjoys popularity among foreigners and overseas Koreans.

articles.title: Song about Korean Nation-First Spirit
articles.content:
Song about Korean Nation-First Spirit 
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- "Pyongyang is Best" is one of the songs most popular among the Korean people.
					 It, often heard on TV and radio and in movies and dancing parties, sings of the Korean people's national pride. 
					
					 It tells what a Korean felt while touring other countries. It is his impressions that flowers, water and melodies of his country are more beautiful, clearer and better than those of other countries. 
					
					 The song is characterized by simple but profound poetic language, fine figurative style and cheerful melodies.
					
					 The song, created in Juche 80 (1991), is a theme song of the multi-part feature film "The Nation and Destiny"

articles.title: DPRK's Popular Labor Policy
articles.content:
DPRK's Popular Labor Policy  
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Working people of the DPRK enjoy an independent and creative life without worries about job.
					 In the socialist country where the people are the masters of the state and society, all the citizens at the age of work have an equal right to work irrespective of race, sex and religious belief.
					
					 They have rights to choose an occupation and receive remuneration for what they did. They are also provided by the state with stable jobs and working conditions.
					
					 Their right to work is guaranteed by law in the country.
					
					 The labor law was promulgated in June Juche 35 (1946) to introduce an eight-hour working system in the country and the socialist labor law enacted in April 1978.
					
					 Seven or six hours working systems are also applied according to the working intensity and conditions.
					
					 Wage, reward and bonus are dependent on the quality and quantity of work done. Those engaged in cooperative economy are paid according to their working days.
					
					 Juvenile labor is not allowed in the DPRK.

articles.title: White Paper on Mind-set of South Koreans Released
articles.content:
White Paper on Mind-set of South Koreans Released
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The National Reunification Institute on Monday released a white paper on the mind-set of the south Korean people critical of the puppet group reflected by media.
					 Noting that south Korean newspapers, broadcasting services and  Internet homepages spared neither space nor time to carry articles, cartoons and animation files critical of the authorities, the white paper stressed that what they dealt with is just a tip of iceberg of the crimes committed by them.
					
					 People of different social standings in south Korea described the past three years of the office of the present authorities as "a period they spent in horror and anxiety," the white paper, noted, and went on:
					
					 South Korean media, commenting on the three years since the puppet group's seizure of power, were unanimous in deploring that they were "a nightmarish period which brought a crisis in democracy, economic crisis of common people and a crisis in the inter-Korean relations", "a period of disgrace and shame", "a period of incompetency, mendicancy and international shame" and "a hellish period during which people lost their hopes.
					
					 The south Korean professors' organizations issued a white paper titled "three years of egotism, arbitrariness and degradation" on the lapse of the three years since the puppet conservative group came to power. It said: "The south Korean society is now in the grip of the extreme crisis due to the present regime's self-righteousness and arbitrariness. Democracy achieved at the cost of blood exists only in name. The south-north relations have stepped back to those before June 25, far from making a step forward towards reunification".
					
					 The dissident organizations in south Korea said that the specter that haunted in the era of dictatorship revived, condemning the unpopular rule of the puppet group as "cannibalistic politics", "horrible politics based on brutality and frenzy" and "politics aimed at not seeking people's understanding but killing them".
					
					 They also labeled the puppet authorities "a regime violating democracy and killing common people", "a regime disregarding the people" and "an intransigent regime".
					
					 Terming the present chief executive's campaign for economic recovery hypocritical, the white paper noted:
					
					 The Citizens Federation for Economic Justice of south Korea said that an analysis of the commitments made by the puppet group to improving the standard of people's living in last February led to the conclusion that none of them has been properly fulfilled, assessing its three years in power as a failure.
					
					 An opinion poll was made on the three years of its office. 74.6 percent of its respondents said they do not believe the policy of the authorities while 81.3 percent of the respondents predicted that the present regime would not be able to settle the economic crisis.
					
					 A politician from an opposition party said that the people are groaning due to the four big problems related to their living: sky-rocketing prices, snowballing money for the lease of a house or room, serious joblessness and foot-and-mouth diseases, adding that it is better to call south Korea a "republic beset with serious problems".
					
					 South Korean people are assailing the authorities for having driven the inter-Korean relations into a collapse and increased the danger of a war in denial and violation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the white paper noted, and continued:
					
					 People of various circles in south Korea dismiss "the waiting strategy" and "adherence to the principle" touted by the conservative group as a far-fetched assertion aimed to shun dialogue.
					
					They call the Ministry of Unification as "ministry which gave up reunification", "ministry for confrontation" and "ministry seeking permanent division." They, at the same time, brand puppet minister of Unification Hyon In Thaek as "a top class criminal who brought the south-north relations to a collapse" and a "speculator for anti-reunification acts," demanding that he be brought to justice before any others.
					
					 According to the results of the recent opinion poll in south Korea, 84.7 percent of the respondents said that they felt uneasy as it seemed that a war may break out at once while 80 percent of them urged the "government" to roll back its policy of confrontation and opt for dialogue with the north.
					
					 Commenting on the puppet group's sycophancy towards the U.S. and Japan and treachery, south Korean media are ridiculing it as "a servant for the U.S.", "a government being deceived by the U.S. and hit on its head by Japan" and "a regime subservient to the U.S. and a regime courteous towards Japan and a good-for-nothing for the people". They are heaping curses on the authorities, slashing at above-said sycophancy and treachery as "crazy diplomacy," "servile diplomacy," "shameful diplomacy," "foolish diplomacy," "diplomacy of idiots," "diplomacy for bringing tribute to other countries", "mendicant diplomacy" and "diplomacy made with empty cans".
					
					 The people's curse and condemnation of the puppet group have reached the brink of explosion, the white paper noted, warning that  the conservative group being forsaken by the people is bound to face a stern judgment by history and the nation and meet a miserable end.

articles.title: Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Minister of Unification Slammed
articles.content:
Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Minister of Unification Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, addressing a recent "international academic symposium",  let loose sheer sophism that south Korea has so far worked hard for dialogue to preserve peace, talking about "uncertain and  unstable security situation" on the Korean Peninsula. He went the lengths of asserting that even if inter-Korean dialogue is held, "it can hardly achieve results" unless someone has "an honest attitude" toward the "Cheonan" warship case and "denuclearization."
					  Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: What traitor Hyon uttered is nothing but the last-ditch effort of the puppet forces to stem the trend of the situation toward dialogue and get rid of their poor position.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are now under the pressure to take an option as their treacherous "policy toward the north" has proved to be totally bankrupt, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Various circles of south Korea and world public are warmly hailing and supporting the DPRK's important proposal for improving the inter-Korean relations and tiding over the grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiations. They are becoming increasingly vocal urging the south Korean authorities to make a switchover in their "policy toward the north" and opt for improving the relations at an early date. Much upset by this, the conservative group is stirring up an atmosphere of confrontation, putting up a "responsible step" from someone as a pre-condition for dialogue. This is aimed to shun dialogue and escape from isolation at home and abroad.
					
					 It is none other than Hyon and other confrontation maniacs of south Korea who make the future of the inter-Korean relations dismal.
					
					 Hyon should be ousted from the political arena as early as possible.

articles.title: Guarantee of Workers' Political Rights Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Guarantee of Workers' Political Rights Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Members of the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society and other civic and public organizations of south Korea at a joint press conference on Apr. 21 demanded the guarantee of the workers' political rights.
					 They said at the press conference that the part-time workers and other workers are denied political rights.
					
					 They accused the "government" and business owners of despicably preventing the workers from participating in voting in every election.
					
					 Even those who went to the polls were persecuted on charges of violation of "law on election" for the mere reason that they voted against the misrule of the authorities, they noted, declaring that they would struggle to have the workers' political rights guaranteed.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Show Held in Guinea
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Show Held in Guinea
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia show was held in Conakry, Guinea, from April 13 to 19 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 On display at its venue were potted Kimilsungias in full bloom. 
					
					 Attending its opening ceremony were the chairman of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association, the general director of the Ministry of Information, the chief of the Group for the Study of Kimjongilism, the general director of the newspaper Horoya, personages of various circles and masses.
					
					 The ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Conakry were present on invitation. 
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Association, said at the opening ceremony that Kimilsungias have come into full bloom in Guinea with deep reverence of the Guinean people and the progressive humankind for Kim Il Sung who made immortal contributions to global independence.
					
					 Kimilsungia will come into fuller bloom the world over, carrying mankind's boundless respect for the most prominent great man in the 20th century, he stressed.
					
					 The general director of Horoya said that he was moved to see Kimilsungias in full bloom in Guinea. He expressed the will to widely introduce this flower of the sun to the Guinean people and thus make positive contribution to developing the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated at DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated at DPRK Missions 
						
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place at DPRK embassies abroad to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung between April 6 and 14.
					 They included receptions, friendly meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows at the embassies in China, Cuba, Vietnam, Laos, Mongolia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Malaysia, Thailand, Germany, Austria, Uzbekistan, Italy, Bulgaria, Ethiopia, South Africa, Equatorial Guinea and Mexico.   
					
					On display there were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos on their undying feats and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 The films shown included "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Pyongyang Today". 
					
					 Present at the events on invitation were personages of different strata, chiefs of Juche idea study organizations and solidarity and friendship organizations and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international bodies and non-governmental organizations in those countries.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from Joint Seminar in London
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Joint Seminar in London
Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Apr. 9 received a letter from the participants in a joint seminar of British political parties and organizations held in London to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The letter said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was the great leader all the progressives of the world look up to.  
					
					 He is remembered and revered as the person who dedicated all his life and energies to the cause of the people. 
					
					 He was a revolutionary who combined the popular masses with the revolutionary movement in Korea as unbreakable. 
					
					 We reaffirm our support to the Korean people in the struggle for denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and durable peace based on justice. 
					
					 We are sure that the unanimous desire of the Korean people to reunify the country in a peaceful way will be certainly realized in the near future, despite turns and twists. 
					
					 The Korean people, who have turned out as one in the drive of a new great surge to build a thriving nation under the Songun leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea in response to the demand of the times, give encouragement to the progressive forces of the whole world. 
					
					 We will stand shoulder to shoulder with the Korean people in the common cause of independence, socialism and future of humankind.

articles.title: Anniversary of KPA Marked in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Anniversary of KPA Marked in Ethiopia
Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea released the 23rd issue of its bulletin on April 19 to mark the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The bulletin carried an article titled "Invincible KPA and Inside of U.S. Forces", which said:
					
					 The KPA is the matchless strong army.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, founder of the KPA and gifted brilliant commander, advanced the Juche-based military idea.
					
					 Guided by this idea, he waged 15 years of armed struggle to defeat the Japanese imperialists and accomplished the historic cause of Korea's liberation.
					
					 In the 1950s he inflicted the first defeat in history on the U.S. imperialists, who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, and honorably defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, who is creditably carrying forward the President's cause, has trained the KPA soldiers to be men of idea and faith fully armed with the Juche-based military idea.
					
					 The military strength of the DPRK is based on the powerful self-reliant defence industry.
					
					 The bulletin cited facts to prove that the U.S. forces are acting as if they were "apostle" of God in different parts of the world, talking about "spread of democracy", "defence of freedom", "anti-terrorism" and the like but their inside are characterized by vulnerability, corruption and barbarity.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung between Apr. 13 and 15. 
					 They included meetings in Norway, Bulgaria and Ecuador, a remembrance meeting in Denmark and a joint meeting in Laos. 
					
					On display in their venues were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos on their immortal feats and other photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Svend Haakon Jacobsen, chairman of the Communist Party of Norway, said that Kim Il Sung led to victory the Korean people's historic struggle from the revolution for national liberation to the socialist construction, performing great exploits which will remain forever in the history of the Korean revolution and the struggle for human emancipation.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il socialist Korea is now dynamically advancing along the road of victory, meeting every challenge of history, he said.
					
					 Mogens Jensen, chief of the Group for the Study of Works of     Kim Jong Il in Denmark, said that Kim Il Sung was the father of the people as he devoted his all to them, regarding the idea of believing in them as in Heaven as his maxim and always finding himself among them to be on the same boat with them.
					
					 He is the peerless patriot and prominent leader who performed undying feats for Korea's reunification and global independence, the chief added.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in Norway, Bulgaria and Denmark.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of Democratic Congo and Myanmar issued statements to mark the 18th publication anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country."
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, in a statement on April 13 said: In the work Kim Il Sung advanced a great programme for national reunification the keynote of which is to avert the division and confrontation through the great unity of the whole nation and establish an independent, peaceful and neutral unified state on the principle of giving priority to the nation's interests. This programme was fully supported and approved by not only all the Koreans but also the world's independent and peace-loving people. It is still recognized as the most fair and above-board reunification proposal. 
					
					 The statement noted that Kim Il Sung, who was the prominent leader of the Korean revolution and the world revolution and worked heart and soul for the people's happiness and the country's prosperity, had dedicated his all to the cause of national reunification till the last moments of his life. 
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, in a statement on April 6 said that 10-point programme clearly indicates the orientation and ways for bringing earlier the reunification of Korea.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il formulated the 10-point programme as well as the three principles of national reunification and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters of national reunification to be invariably adhered to by the Korean nation under any situation and circumstance, the statement said.

articles.title: Crisis Remains Still Serious at Nuclear Power Plant in Japan
articles.content:
Crisis Remains Still Serious at Nuclear Power Plant in Japan
Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) --The crisis at the crippled nuclear power plant in Japan still remains a serious problem. 
					The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan, quoting the results of the analysis of the level of cesium detected in the waters near the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant, said that cesium of 83.3Bq per one liter was detected in the sea water 30 km away from the power plant.
					
					Minute traces of plutonium were found in the soil in two places in the compound of the above-said power plant. 
					
					The government declared five cities, chons and sons near the power plant highly contaminated by radiation as evacuation areas. 
					
					The Wall Street Journal noted that the pressure inside the containment vessel of Reactor No. 1 at the time of the first explosion at the Japanese nuclear power plant rose two times that under the design but the situation deteriorated because of the Tokyo Electric Power Co's negligence. 
					
					According to the results of the opinion poll conducted by an opinion survey group of Japan among inhabitants, three persons out of four considered the crisis at the power plant as the biggest worry. 
					
					Meanwhile, radioactive materials were detected in a second-hand car imported from Japan in a Far-eastern area of Russia. 
					
					The damage by quake and the ensuing tsunami is increasing in Japan. 
					
					The Japan National Police Agency announced that the death toll caused by quake and the ensuing tsunami increased to 14,300 and the number of those unaccounted for to 11,999 as of 16:00 Sunday. Aftershocks are going on. 
					
					A magnitude of 6 quake rocked an eastern part of Japan on Saturday. 
					
					Its epicenter was 10 km deep under waters off Sanriku of Iwate Prefecture. 
					
					According to the results of a recent analysis, the speed of the tsunami caused by the massive quake reached 115 km per hour and the maximum height of tsunami registered 38.9 m, the highest in the history of observation in Japan.

articles.title: China Clarifies Stand on Development of Cross-border Rivers
articles.content:
China Clarifies Stand on Development of Cross-border Rivers
 Beijing, April 24 (KCNA) -- Spokeswoman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry Hong Lei, addressing a recent press conference, mentioned the development and use of cross-border rivers.
					 It was reported that China built dams on rivers crossing the border, arousing concern from neighboring countries.
					
					 On this report, she said that China has maintained understandings with them to take into deep consideration their interests. 
					
					 China has taken responsible attitude toward development and use of cross-border rivers, she added.

articles.title: New Sci-Tech Institute Established in China
articles.content:
New Sci-Tech Institute Established in China
						
 Beijing, April 24 (KCNA) -- An institute for scientific and technological development strategy was inaugurated in China recently.
					 The Chinese Academy of Engineer and Qinghua University jointly organized the institute. Its main mission is to maintain far-sighted orientation of development at a high level and provide assistance to deciding important strategies in the field of the state engineering.
					
					 The institute will be the first-class think tank in the engineering of China.

articles.title: Book on CPLA's History Published in China
articles.content:
Book on CPLA's History Published in China
 Beijing, April 24 (KCNA) -- Book which deals with the war history of Huabei field units of the Chinese People's Liberation Army was recently published in China.
					 The book covers the period from September 1945 when China won the anti-Japanese war to May 1950 when the large-scale battles ended across the country.

articles.title: Russia's Efforts to Increase Its Armed Forces' Combat Capability
articles.content:
Russia's Efforts to Increase Its Armed Forces' Combat Capability
 Moscow, April 24 (KCNA) -- Russian armed forces are directing efforts to the exercises aimed at boosting the combat capability of their units.
					 Units of anti-submarine and missile ships and flotillas of missile craft and mini-missile craft of the Black Sea Fleet staged tactical maneuvers some days ago.
					
					 Through the exercises, they boosted the capabilities for bombardment and missile attacks on the targets in the sea, air and coast. 
					
					 The strategic flying corps of the air force staged a commanding staff drill with more than 40 aircraft of various types involved.
					
					 Meanwhile, air defence units successfully carried out the mission to repulse the intensive missile strikes and flying corps' attack of the imaginary enemy through a drill conducted in a firing range in Astrakhan Region.

articles.title: Lenin's Birth Anniversary Commemorated in Russia
articles.content:
Lenin's Birth Anniversary Commemorated in Russia 
						
 Moscow, April 24 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Russia on April 22 to commemorate the 141st birth anniversary of V. Lenin. 
					 A ceremony of laying wreaths before the mausoleum of Lenin at Red Square was held in Moscow.
					
					 Present there were representatives of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, trade union organizations, veterans' organizations, Pioneer organizations and other political parties and organizations and thousands of citizens from all walks of life. 
					
					 Gennadi Zyuganov, leader of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, said at the ceremony that Lenin's exploits for mankind are always immortal.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants marched through Red Square, holding Lenin's portraits and red flags and chanting such slogans as "Lenin is alive." 
					
					 On the same day, ceremonies of laying wreaths and flowers before the memorials to Lenin, seminars and other various events took place in many cities and regions of Russia including Sankt-Peterburg and Kaluga Region. And documentary films on Lenin's revolutionary life were screened at cinemas.

articles.title: NAM Blasts Israel's Continued Expansion of Settlements
articles.content:
NAM Blasts Israel's Continued Expansion of Settlements
Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian ambassador to the United Nations, speaking on behalf of NAM at a Security Council open debate on April 21 on the situation of the Middle East, denounced Israel's continued expansion of settlements. 
					With Israel's refusal to renew the unilateral moratorium on settlement activities and recent announcements regarding the establishment of more settlement units, it "totally contradicts the Israeli government's alleged commitment to the peace process," he said.
					
					NAM "reiterates its call for the Security Council to be resolute in demanding that Israel abides by its legal obligations," he added.

articles.title: More People Killed in US Drone Attack in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
More People Killed in US Drone Attack in NW Pakistan 
Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are killing Pakistanis everyday under the signboard of "anti-terrorism."
					At least 20 people were killed and several others seriously injured in a U.S. drone attack launched early Friday morning in North Waziristan of Pakistan. 
					
					To date, at least 174 people have been reported killed in the strikes launched by the U.S. drones since the beginning of this year.

articles.title: Standard and Poors Estimates US Economic Situation as Negative
articles.content:
Standard and Poors Estimates US Economic Situation as Negative
Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Standard and Poors degraded the U.S. credit rating, indicative of its economic situation, from level of "stable" to "negative".
					 One of the main factors is the increasing budget deficit and state debt in the U.S., it pointed out.
					
					 It added that policy-makers of the U.S. have not yet come to an agreement over how to grapple with the still hard financial difficulty even though several years have passed since the financial crisis.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia la función del Coro Estatal Benemérito
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia la función del Coro Estatal Benemérito
						
Pyongyang, 26 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea vio la función del Coro Estatal Benemérito con motivo del aniversario 79 de la fundación del heroico EPC.
					El Dirigente felicitó a los ejecutantes y los espectadores que acogen esa efeméride.
					
					Se pusieron en la escena el coro masculino "Viva el Generalísimo Kim Il Sung", el solo femenino y coro masculino "¿Dónde está el querido General?", el solo y coro masculinos "Por la única Patria", "Defenderemos a muerte la Dirección de la Revolución" y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patético la trayectoria orgullosa por la cual el heroico EPC ha venido recorriendo bajo la bandera roja de la revolución registrando la victoria y la gloria y ostentó con vigor la férrea convicción e inconmovible voluntad del ejército y el pueblo coreanos de llevar a feliz término la causa revolucionaria del Juche y la de construcción de la gran potencia próspera, iniciadas en la selva del monte Paektu.
					
					El Dirigente se mostró muy satisfecho de que el Coro Estatal Benemérito haya ofrecido una función magnífica y les dio el agradecimiento a todos los creadores y artistas apreciando en lo alto el éxito de su función.
					
					Dijo que la historia de lucha del EPC de casi 80 años brilla como una trayectoria orgullosa de que creó la tradición valiosa a la cabeza de la Revolución del Songun y la mantuvo con firmeza y manifestó una gran esperaza y su convicción de que el EPC cumplirá su honrosa misión de abanderado y vanguardia para apoyar la decisión y la voluntad del PTC de construir sobre el territorio patrio, cueste lo que cueste, una gran potencia próspera socialista para así hacer florecer como la realidad el anhelo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y ofrecer al pueblo coreano la vida más culta y feliz en el mundo.
					
					Le acompañaron en verla los cuadros directivos del partido y el ejército: Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk y Ju Kyu Chang, los miembros de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC: Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Myong Guk, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Choe Pu Il, Kim Yong Chol y Yun Jong Rin, el ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, Ri Myong Su, el jefe de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae, oficiales y soldados del EPC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia palabras provocativas de Hyon In Thaek
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia palabras provocativas de Hyon In Thaek
Pyongyang, 26 de abril (ATCC) -- En un "seminario internacional" recién celebrado, Hyon In Thaek dijo que es "opaca e inestable la seguridad" de la Península Coreana y añadió que ellos mismos vinieron esforzándose por el diálogo para preservar la paz. Y agregó que el diálogo Norte-Sur, que se reanude, no puede ser "fructífero" sin la "actitud sincera" de alguien sobre el caso de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y la "desnuclearización". 
					Tales palabras del traidor Hyon no pasan de ser últimos esfuerzos por frenar la corriente de la situación hacia el diálogo y salvarse del dilema. 
					
					Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este martes y continúa:
					
					Ahora las autoridades surcoreanas se encuentran en la crisis debido al fracaso total de su "política sobre el Norte" de carácter antinacional. 
					
					Los diferentes círculos surcoreanos y la opinión pública mundial expresan entero apoyo a la propuesta importante de la RPDC de superar las graves dificultades creadas en las relaciones intercoreanas y en la Península Coreana mediante el diálogo y negociaciones y demandan fuertemente a las autoridades surcoreanas cambiar cuanto antes su "política sobre el Norte" y mejorar las relaciones con éste. 
					
					Muy inquietados por ello, los conservadores surcoreanos pretenden inculcar el ambiente de enfrentamiento presentando como premisa del diálogo "las medidas responsables" de alguien, evadir el diálogo y liberarse del aislamiento en el interior y exterior del país. 
					
					Los maníacos de confrontación del Sur de Corea como el traidor Hyon oscurecen el porvenir de las relaciones íntercoreanas. 
					
					Hay que sepultar cuanto antes en lo político al traidor Hyon.

articles.title: IRP publica carta blanca sobre la opinión pública del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
IRP publica carta blanca sobre la opinión pública del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 26 de abril (ATCC) -- El Instituto de la Reunificación de la Patria (IRP) publicó el día 25 la carta blanca de la opinión pública del Sur de Corea sobre las autoridades títeres surcoreanas.
					En los periódicos, radios e Internet del Sur de Corea se publican de sobra los artículos, caricaturas y videos que critican a las autoridades, comienza la nota y continúa:
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos de distintos sectores señalan que los 3 años pasados de mandato de las actuales autoridades fueron el "tiempo asfixiante por el pavor e inquietud".
					
					Al publicar los artículos que balancean ese trienio, los medios de prensa lo calificaron unánimemente como "3 años de pesadilla que trajeron la crisis para la democracia, la vida económica de población humilde y las relaciones Sur-Norte", "3 años de cinismo, arrogancia y desvergüenza", "3 años de incapacidad, mendicación y vergüenza en la arena internacional" y "3 años infernales que apagaron los destellos de esperanza". 
					
					En su carta blanca publicada sobre los mismos 3 años bajo el título de "3 años de porfía, arbitrariedad y retroceso", las entidades de profesores surcoreanos señalaron así: "Debido al egoísmo y voluntariedad del poder actual, la sociedad surcoreana llegó al extremo de crisis. La democracia conquistada con sangre existe sólo formalmente. Las relaciones íntercoreanas dieron marcha atrás al estado antes del 25 de junio (día de inicio de la pasada guerra coreana) sin dar ni un paso adelante hacia la reunificación".
					
					Las entidades de activistas opinaron que se ha resucitado el fantasma de la época de dictadura y calificaron la política antipopular de la camarilla de autoridades títeres como la "política caníbal", "la pavorosa de barbaridad y locura" y la "de exterminio del pueblo sin la menor comunicación con éste".
					
					Definieron a las autoridades títeres como "el poder asesino que acaba con la democracia y mata a los humildes", "el poder que desprecia al pueblo", "el poder inválido", etc. 
					
					En cuanto a la farsa de revitalización de la economía orquestada por el actual mandatario surcoreano, la Federación de Ciudadanos por la Economía Justa del Sur de Corea reveló que no se ha cumplido ninguna de las promesas relacionadas con la vida del pueblo presentadas en febrero del año pasado por la banda de títeres y calificó de suspenso los 3 años del poder actual. 
					
					De acuerdo con el resultado de la encuesta realizada con motivo de cumplirse 3 años de mandato del poder actual, 74.6% no confían en la política de las autoridades y 81.3% dijeron que éstas son incapaces de resolver la crisis económica.
					
					Un político del partido opositor dijo que los habitantes surcoreanos sufren 4 tipos de caos que incluyen el de precios, el de alquiler anticipado, el de empleos y el de fiebre aftosa y describió el Sur de Corea como "la república de grandes caos".
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos denuncian a las autoridades que aumentaron la crisis de guerra negando y violando la Declaración Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaración del 4 de Octubre y llevando las relaciones íntercorenas a la ruptura.
					
					Los surcoreanos de distintos sectores subrayan que la banda de conservadores insiste en la "estrategia de espera" y el "mantenimiento de principios" con el fin de no acudir al diálogo.
					
					Califican al Ministerio de Reunificación como "el ministerio que renunció la reunificación", "el de enfrentamiento" y "el de división" e insisten en llevar primero al banquillo de acusados al titular de esa cartera Hyon In Thaek tildándolo como "criminal de peor calaña que frustró las relaciones íntercoreanas" y el "especulador anti-reunificación". 
					
					Según el resultado de las recientes encuestas, 84. 7 % de los consultados expresaron su preocupación por el posible estallido de guerra y 80 % demandaron que el "gobierno" cancele su política conflictiva con el Norte y proceda al diálogo con éste.
					
					Los medios de prensa surcoreanos ironizan el servilismo vendepatria a EE.UU. y Japón de la camarilla surcoreana usando estas expresiones: "sirviente de EE.UU.", "gobierno embaucado por EE.UU. y golpeado por Japón por la espalda" y "el bueno para EE.UU., el cortés para Japón y el inútil para el pueblo".
					
					En cuanto a la diplomacia surcoreana, le envían improperios de toda clase como "la loca", "la sumisa", "la vergonzosa", etc. 
					
					La cólera y la condena del pueblo contra la banda de autoridades títeres llegan al borde de explosión.
					
					Esta camarilla repudiada por el pueblo llegará a su trágico fin siendo condenada severamente por la historia y la nación.

articles.title: Iniciado 26º Festival Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología
articles.content:
Iniciado 26º Festival Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología 
Pyongyang, 26 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedó inaugurado el día 26 en la Exposición Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones el 26º Festival Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología, que se realizará dividido en 19 secciones como la industria ligera, la agricultura, la industria carbonífera, la eléctrica, la metalúrgica, la mecánica, la biológica, la química, etc. 
					Se presentaron en la ocasión más de 350 logros científico-técnicos, que obtuvieron el visto bueno en los festivales locales, y los otros alcanzados por más de una veintena de fábricas y empresas.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ceremonia inaugural el secretario del Comité Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Jon Ha Chol, el presidente de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, Jang Chol, el presidente del Comité de Educación, Kim Yong Jin, y otros funcionarios correspondientes, los científicos, técnicos y trabajadores.
					
					Pronunció un discurso de apertura Ri Ja Bang, presidente del Comité Central de la Federación General de Ciencia y Técnica de Corea y del Comité Estatal de Ciencia y Técnica.
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes recorrieron los materiales exhibidos.
